turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Is this a May Day pageant?  Are you all off on a lark...?  The raven passed this way hours ago!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Heading north still?

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: True north...  Straight up that pass, through the net.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: The fastest in the world.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I know where to find him... He lies out on the marsh, raven-fodder; his horn torn from his head.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: What do we do now?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We wait.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: What's she doing?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I think she's about to foal.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm in your debt, Screwball.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Watch behind or I'll never collect on it!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Praise be to God.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Small miracles better than no miracles...

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Master Jack!  Master Jack!  These woods are alive!  They're alive!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Of course they're alive.  All nature is living.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Up ahead!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Come on, Gump, let's have a look at this witchcraft.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: What can you steal from a man already lost his life?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: His honor, I suppose... seeing he no longer can defend it.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: What care the bones when the soul is free?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bah!  You faeries have the morals of ferrets.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Maybe there's a better idea... What about birds... get a lift from some friendly bird...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Haven't heard a bird sing in days...

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Or a kite...!  We could make a kite... Let the wind do the work --

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Hello, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Done like a champion.  Can you reach me with the line?

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Sorry, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's done... we'll never catch him.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Your fond wishes give me strength, dear friends.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: No speeches!  What's a little swim after sticking worms and ogres?

turns.speaker: THURGIS
turns.text: Each fit for a hero... My uncle fashioned a hammer for Thor.  Twas he named it Mjolnir.  Grandfather forged Excalibur... You won't ever see finer craftsmanship.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, but I have.

turns.speaker: THURGIS
turns.text: How came you by this blade?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I slew the Lindfarne Worm with it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The Avatar.  I like the sound of it.

turns.speaker: THURGIS
turns.text: Sigurd the Volsung slew Fafnir with that blade... See the line where Regin welded the break?

turns.speaker: THURGIS
turns.text: Uhm... fine work.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Achilles wore it before the gates of Troy.

turns.speaker: THURGIS
turns.text: You're well equipped, I'd say. Legendary arms...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're with us in battle.

turns.speaker: THURGIS
turns.text: May God protect you.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No hurt Jimmy, sir... oh no, please, sir...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sending you back to Hell!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is he a friend, then?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yes, yes... Jimmy Squarefoot good friend to one and all...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Forgive my blood haste, Jimmy Squarefoot, but I want no more surprises from Couer de Noir.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: The Black Baron, you say?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Lost?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Much good we do the world, for all our noble quest...

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Jimmy Squarefoot no lost.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Simple as that, eh?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Castle Couer de Noir built with magic... simple as death... strong as hate...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You do know where it is?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Can you show us the way?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: To Castle Couer de Noir?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There'll be spoils aplenty if you guide us there.  Once we breach the walls, help yourself to all you can carry.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: That very nice.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Let that be our problem, just get us there.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You follow.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It be the castle... we feel the castle... it be that close...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A castle's but stone and mortar --

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Nay.  Castle Couer de Noir is Devil's work... built with sorrow and grief...

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Plenty treasure inside... Jimmy seen it once.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You've been inside?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: In a dream.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't speak to me of dreams!  I feel I've been dreaming since the unicorn was killed.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Marco!

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I'm not cheating!  I'm not looking!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Dad's disappeared!

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: He was there and then he wasn't!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And we got to take all the old paint off all the doors and then George taught us how to stain everything and he even let me choose the color I liked best!  And he said he loved me!

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: We did a lot of the wiring too.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: With Dale.  Oh, and I got to drill a hole into a board to put the wire through!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Are you going to see Sam again?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I thought I might stop by.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You can go back to bed...or Lois might let you go swimming.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I wanna be with you today.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Oh, honey.  There's not much to do there. I mean, it's all work.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We can work.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I woke up this morning at three and couldn't fall back asleep.  Everyday I think I see more of Sam than I've seen in years.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Sam!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Did you know him before you knew Dad?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Since seventh grade.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And video games after!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Home after.  Will you come in and say "hi"?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: That's how you get things right is to always try and never give up.  Huh, Mom?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I guess it depends on what you give up on.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: He's not there.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: He's here.  Check the bathroom.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I checked everywhere.  He's not there.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: When does George get to come see his house?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: It's so beautiful.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's that for?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Mom said I should.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I would have anyway.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: So put your plans of my room in the trash.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I don't think Dad wants you home.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He hasn't called?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Do you guys feel like painting?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What color?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Red.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I love red!  That's my favorite color!

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Mom?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Here, honey!

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I put him to work.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I couldn't get it to go down.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: And why was the alarm on?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Oh...I set it to see if it would work.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: You'd better call and cancel.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Oh God, we don't want the police!

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: What are you doing up so early?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I couldn't sleep last night.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I'm supposed to be mad at you, but I'm not.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Why?  What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Uh...using Josh like that.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I'm going to bed.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Has he eaten anything at all?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I'd be more comfortable if he slept in the guestroom.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I'd be more comfortable if you hadn't slept with Josh.  And George would be more comfortable if he weren't dying.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Atonement.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Who are all these people?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Sorry I got you into trouble.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'll survive.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: He must.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: He seems lonely.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Are you his friend?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Marilyn Manson...and I guess he's into guys.  I hate nose rings.  And the blue eye shadow thing really isn't working.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Alyssa.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Why have you put a toilet and a bed in your garage?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm living here while I build another house.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Is that legal?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Don't you have school?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What's today?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Monday.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: My keys.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I had them in my pocket.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I'm not shaving my legs or pits this summer, I've decided.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Can you keep Sam straight?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: He's not gay.  I found out purely by accident, believe me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I mean drugs.  I thought you said he was?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: He wouldn't use around me.  I don't like any of it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You're a good girl.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I need to ask you something, Mr. Nelson.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You have to ask like that?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I want you to try something with me, okay?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I've taken a lot of morphine.  Oral morphine...for my back.  Can I wait till I can say no and sound convincing?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Did you feel anything?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Maybe your tongue...I don't know, my mouth is numb.  Why did you do that?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: My mother would die.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Let's shut up and not kill her.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: It's not what I was expecting.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What did you think it would be?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I don't know...  More like when I kissed Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm hungry!  Where's my dinner?  Who ate my dinner?  Huh?  Who's in trouble now?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: They're trying to make me spend the summer here.  I'm leaving in the morning.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Where to?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm supposed to be in Tahoe.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Your dad's really gonna build his house?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Well, if you don't go, I guess I'll see you.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: You should stay.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Where's your dad?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He jumped into the ocean.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Tell him I said "hi".

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He's a freak.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: You look better without make-up.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I can't even take a shower here.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Come over to my house whenever you want. I'll tell my mom.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I might not stay, anyway.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I'll get your back.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No.  That's okay.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Do you remember me from when you lived here?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Your dad dated my mom after her divorce.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I wanted him to marry her.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Turn over.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Josh and I are going to South Coast. Wanna ride?  Maybe see a movie?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I can use your mom's.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I'm okay.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Not really.  No.  Kinda.  He got busted?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: His parents took his car.  They're making him ride a bicycle the rest of the summer.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: He asked me to tell you that you owe him a hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He can peddle over anytime he wants to for it.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: This is serious!  I don't have my license.  He was my ride.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm just here to shower.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I've seen lots of people.  It's not a big thing for me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hand me a towel.  I'm getting out.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I'm coming in.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't want you to!

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: We're not gonna do anything.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Why are you so stupid?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Why are you so uptight?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't even...what do you mean?  I don't even know what that means.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: It means I'm gonna shampoo my hair and stay out of your way.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hand me a towel.  Hand me a towel.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's the point of this?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Does everything have to have a point?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's freakish.  I don't get it.  I'm not really supposed to touch you, but I can look.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Are you sure you're totally into guys?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Josh said...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm not gay.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I was wondering.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You're driving me crazy!  Do you know what it's like trying to jack-off in an armoire?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Not really.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You're off, you know?  You're way, way off.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I thought I was helping you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It would help me if I could kiss you.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: No, I don't...NO.  I thought we were just friends.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What you think, you know, doesn't have much to do with reality.  I mean, I hope I'm not the first to say that about you.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Okay, but then we'll just be friends. Okay?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Okay.  I guess.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: On the handlebars or your shoulders?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Are you afraid of heights?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hey, I can get you three hundred cash for two hours.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You hate your father.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: If he tricked me into loving him, is what I meant.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You'd hate him for the trick.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Not if what he left me was real.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't wanna go.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: He asked where you were!  He wants you with him.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't wanna go.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Where are you?!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Floating to Catalina.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You're so nice to let Sam use your shower.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: He's got a standing invitation.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Why is that?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Just, I mean, well, you're here every single day.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: He's at work while I'm here.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I guess I'd just be jealous if I were him.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Well, he doesn't need to worry.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: If my kids and my wife were always at an ex-husband's house, I'd worry.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: He's not the type to worry.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: He won't leave my room.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Will he talk to me?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: This is such a street of whiners.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: From Tuesday to yesterday, not including Monday or today.  Okay...Mrs. Dokos is repeatedly running over her lawn.  The Corliss' have attributed the increase in rat population in their environs to the state of your...structure.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: IPO's caused the rat population on this street.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: And of course the Beck's, with the...

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: It could have been a squirt gun.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: You've been good this week.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Are you guys' friends?

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: We've known each other since grade school.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I mean, but did you both go camping on weekends?  Listen to music?  Masturbate together?  Talk on the phone?

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: I wouldn't want you as a friend.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: George just never really...aimed that high.  Even with not hitting a rabbit.  I knew you were doing that, by the way. That's why I stopped doing it with you. You were no fun.  It was always like you were frightened.  Quiet and boring.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: Funny how he's the architect and you're just a loud mouth cop.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: He builds models for architects.  His dad, on the other hand, was the real deal.  Designed and built the coolest houses I've ever seen.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: Mr. Dokos says that your father missed his height envelope by six inches.

turns.speaker: ALYSSA
turns.text: He wants the entire roof taken off and lowered.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Mr. Stevens?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I've been dreading you.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Bob Larson.  Do you happen to have an unenclosed toilet in close proximity to a kitchen?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: A violation?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Oh, yes.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: And if I enclosed it?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: An exhaust system or a window is code.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: A sink?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Allowed outside the enclosed area.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I hate to ask about a window.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I flushed it down the toilet.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I assume you'll fill the...uh, window, with glass?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: If that's what it takes.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Mr. Stevens.  One of your neighbors is adamant your home has exceeded its approved height.  He's filed to have construction stopped immediately.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's thirty feet.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Well, if it is, we have a problem.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I have the permit.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: After your last extension request and with Design Review and the Board of Adjustment and the appeals to the city council, was there an amended permit?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: To the patio and one north-facing window...  And six inches to the height.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: That would take weeks.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Months.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm good, thanks.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: What are you on?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Pardon me?

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: how much weight have you lost?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh...nothing.  Thirty pounds.  I just haven't been very hungry.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: How's your wife?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: When we divorce a decade ago, she was very, very angry.  Now she's just hostile.
